The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles are -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Create a new 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Construct loop 1 of the sketch with the following curves: * line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.0] * line 2: Start Point [0.5, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.5] * line 3: Start Point [0.5, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] * line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop. The loop is complete and the face is formed. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.125 units and scale the sketch by 0.5. **Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the edges are straight. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units.** Create a new coordinate system for part 2. The euler angles are -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 and the translation vector is [0.125, 0.0, 0.0]. Create a new 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Construct loop 1 of the sketch with the following curves: * line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.0] * line 2: Start Point [0.5, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.375] * line 3: Start Point [0.5, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.125] * line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop. The loop is complete and the face is formed. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.5 units and scale the sketch by 0.5. Join the newly created prism to the preceding CAD models.</description>

For the sketch on face 1, create a loop consisting of 4 lines: - Line 1: starts at (0, 0) and ends at (0.75, 0) - Line 2: starts at (0.75, 0) and ends at (0.75, 0.75) - Line 3: starts at (0.75, 0.75) and ends at (0, 0.75) - Line 4: starts at (0, 0.75) and ends at (0, 0) Extrude the sketch by 0.18 units in the positive normal direction and set the scaling parameter to 0.75. **Part 2: Two cylinders side by side** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [90, 0, -90] - Translation Vector: [0, 0.645, 0.045] For the sketch on face 1, create a loop consisting of a circle: - Center: (0.045, 0.045) - Radius: 0.045 For the sketch on face 2, create a loop consisting of a circle: - Center: (0.495, 0.045) - Radius: 0.045 Extrude the sketches in the negative normal direction by 0.225 units, and set the scaling parameter to 0.54. **Part 3: Cylindrical object with a smaller cylinder on top** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [-90, 0, -90] - Translation Vector: [0.75, 0.105, 0.045] For the sketch on face 1, create a loop consisting of a circle: - Center: (0.045, 0.045) - Radius: 0.045 For the sketch on face 2, create a loop consisting of a circle: - Center: (0.495, 0.045) - Radius: 0.045 Extrude the sketches in the negative normal direction by 0.225 units, and set the scaling parameter to 0.54. The final shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole on one of its faces, created by combining the three intermediate CAD parts above. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.24 units, and the diameter of the cylindrical hole is approximately 0.18 x 0.23 units.</description>
